event_context.catalyst: Volato Group merger with M2i Global (All-Stock)

failures.note: Z-Score of -5.36 indicates imminent bankruptcy risk. In an all-stock merger, if the deal breaks, the downside is likely 100% (insolvency).

passes.note: Appears to be a friendly/negotiated merger

thesis_assessment.bull_case: Speculative reverse merger play. If successful, shareholders transition to M2i Global equity. Potential for high volatility upside if deal closes.
thesis_assessment.bear_case: Extreme financial distress (Z-Score -5.36). If the deal fails (regulatory, shareholder vote, financing), SOAR likely goes to zero/bankruptcy. All-stock nature exposes holders to the acquirer's risk as well.
thesis_assessment.framework_view: The framework explicitly filters out targets with high bankruptcy risk (Z-Score < 1.81) to protect capital in 'deal break' scenarios. SOAR is a textbook example of this risk.

lessons_learned: Micro-cap reverse mergers often involve distressed shells.
Z-Score is a highly effective filter for avoiding 'deal break' zeros in merger arb.
All-stock deals in distressed companies are effectively 'rescue financing' in disguise.
